I.R./ Zyber/ IRIS

* Iron Raptor looked out over the Conference Room before simply sighing and 
exiting it through the door, leading into the many halls of the Cybertronian 
Fire.
She shivered and hugged herself to try and keep warm, wondering if there was 
some sort of draft in this battle ship to cause such a shudder.
With a shrug she simply continued to walk through the halls of the CF, the 
need to stretch her legs more important then sitting in a stuffy room all 
day.
But most of all, she was thinking of Prowl and if he was alright.
It had been a while since he�d been gone and she wondered what he was up to.
But then just as she was thinking of what Prowl could be doing at the moment 
she suddenly felt a sharp pain just behind her spark, making her stop dead 
and gasp.
Iron Raptor stood there and cringed as the pain got sharper for a moment, 
then seemed to begin to fade into a numbing throb.
She took in a deep breath and leaned against the wall on her near side, a 
thin sweat already coating her forehead.
That was strange, the pain seemed to come out of nowhere and just strike. 
And her scanners didn�t report anything wrong either.
Iron Raptor sighed and stood up straight, wiping the sweat from her brow.
The pain was now completely gone now, but she also wondered just where it 
had gone to.
Though, the more she thought about it the more she wondered if it was just a 
stretched tendon or something, and in the end, that was what she reguarded 
it as.
Though�it was much�much more.

_________________________Zyber

* Zyber placed a jug of water and a bowl full of herbs, a stone container 
and a small drinking cup beside the fire which was set in the middle of her 
room.
The stasis locked bot slept on her fur covered bed in the center of the back 
wall, the heat of the fire warming the small room.
Zyber sat on her heals and placed a small metal rack over the fire, resting 
it on the stones that surrounded it.
She poured the water into the bowl once she had emptied it and placed the 
herbs into it, knowing that it would make a strong tea. The tea she would 
feed to the bot once he woke up, it would warm his insides while help repair 
his internals too.
She left the tea to boil while she took the small stone container and walked 
over to the head of her bed and kneeled down, inside the container was the 
salve that she would use to wake this great bot.
Zyber sighed and took a fair wad of the salve onto the tip of her finger and 
began to rub it into the chest of the beast, knowing that it would absorbe 
into his lungs and help with any breathing problems he might have as well as 
wake him up slowly.
She finished rubbing in the salve and wiped the remainder of it from her 
fingers with the edge of one of her furs, then turning towards the tea once 
again.
Zyber groaned as she felt her aching muscles complain as she sat down by the 
fire, leaning her back against the footboard she had made for her bed years 
ago.
Now, all there was left to do was wait�and hope for the best.*

____________________________IRIS

* Her scanners reptored some other bot which requested her help, or 
something of her, she wasn�t sure.
Iris turned her scanners towards the bot whom had spoken, her data base 
identifying it as Ramulus.*

� What is it you need to know?�

* She had missed half of what he had said, and only knew that he was 
speaking to her.
Iris had been too busy looking over the remainder of the ship and deciding 
how to reconstruct it before her attention was drawn to this bot.*
